pr_title: [DROOLS-5485] Move test cases from drools-mvel to drools-test-coverage

timeline.bodyText: Basically, I will move test cases under org.drools.mvel.integrationtests which are usually DRL based tests. Once finished, I will likely check if there are any other good test cases to move.
timeline.author: tkobayas

replies.bodyText:
I heard that Luca (DROOLS-5731) will move drools-model-compiler test cases to a new module under drools-test-coverage (not test-compiler-integration) so we can keep the drools-model-compiler test cases almost unchanged.
But these drools-mvel tests are moved under test-compiler-integration. I don't have a strong reason but I thought they will fit well with existing test-compiler-integration test cases.
replies.author: tkobayas

timeline.bodyText: Basically, I can replace CommonTestMethodBase.loadKnowledgeBaseFromString(drl) with KieBaseUtil methods. Now we can test with specified configurations (standard/flow/pattern).
timeline.author: tkobayas

replies.bodyText: Yes good idea, I think one of the advantages of doing this is not having many different ways to instantiate a KieSession
replies.author: lucamolteni

timeline.bodyText: I will follow the typical approach of test-compiler-integration
timeline.author: tkobayas

timeline.bodyText: At the moment, I use the same package name org.drools.mvel.integrationtests but probably it's not suitable after finishing the move because these tests are no longer specific to mvel. org.drools.compiler.integrationtests is already used by existing test cases. If you have a good candidate name, let me know :)
